newsitem.title: UK: Natwest down in early trade on options loss.
newsitem.headline: Natwest down in early trade on options loss.

text.p: Shares in National Wesminster Bank Plc tumbled in early trading on Monday as the stock went ex-dividend and also reacted to the bank's announcement after the close on Friday of a 50 million stg loss on options trading.
NatWest shares, which set a record 845p on February 10, were down 43p at 715-1/2 by 0820 GMT -- their lowest since early January.
Yet some said the stock should rally later in the session and that the losses should be no great long-term concern to the group, which has expanded in investment banking in the past year.
"The shares will overreact but this is really no big deal for NatWest," said one. By 0825 GMT the stock had recovered to be down 37p at 721-1/2.
